skill.name: defi-registry-manager
skill.description: Manages expansion of tokens, pools, chains, networks, and DEXes across the codebase. Use when adding new tokens, protocols, chains, networks, or updating existing DeFi registry data. Triggers on add token, new coin, add protocol, new DEX, add chain, new network, add RPC, update address.
skill.summary: Manages expansion of tokens, pools, chains, networks, and DEXes across the codebase. Use when adding...
skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only checklists, templates, and guidance for managing DeFi registry data. No filesystem access, network calls, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Adding tokens, protocols, chains, or networks to a DeFi registry requires updates across multiple files. This skill provides checklists, templates, and validation commands to ensure consistent registry updates across frontend, backend, Rust core, and shared schema files.
actual_capabilities: Provides checklists for adding tokens to multiple registry files
Offers templates for token, protocol, and chain configurations
Lists all files that must be updated for each registry type
Includes validation commands to verify consistency
Documents common token addresses and network configurations
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files automatically
Requires manual application of templates by the AI or user
Does not connect to blockchain nodes to verify addresses
Does not provide real-time RPC endpoint availability checks

use_cases.title: Add new token to registry
use_cases.description: Add a new token across all frontend, backend, and Rust core files with proper decimals and checksum addresses

use_cases.title: Add support for new chain
use_cases.description: Configure a new blockchain network with RPC URLs, chain ID, block time, and gas settings

use_cases.title: Integrate new DEX
use_cases.description: Add a new decentralized exchange to the arbitrage and price oracle services with router addresses

prompt_templates.title: Add a new token
prompt_templates.prompt: Add the token [TOKEN_NAME] with address [TOKEN_ADDRESS] on [CHAIN_NAME] to the DeFi registry. It has [DECIMALS] decimals. Follow the token checklist in the defi-registry-manager skill.

prompt_templates.title: Add a new chain
prompt_templates.prompt: Add support for [CHAIN_NAME] mainnet to the DeFi registry. The chain ID is [CHAIN_ID] and block time is [BLOCK_TIME] seconds.

prompt_templates.title: Add a DEX
prompt_templates.prompt: Add [DEX_NAME] to the protocol registry. The router address is [ROUTER_ADDRESS] and it supports [CHAIN].

prompt_templates.title: Configure RPC
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure [CHAIN_NAME] RPC endpoint using the template from defi-registry-manager. The RPC URL is [RPC_URL].

best_practices: Always verify token addresses on a block explorer before adding them
Double-check decimals for stablecoins (6) and wrapped BTC (8) versus standard tokens (18)
Update ALL required files together to prevent runtime errors
anti_patterns: Adding tokens to only some files while forgetting others
Using non-checksum addresses which can cause transaction failures
Skipping validation commands after making registry changes

faq.question: Which files need updating when adding a new token?
faq.answer: Update client/src/constants/protocols.ts, rust-core/crates/core/src/tokens.rs, server/src/services/wallet.ts, and shared/schema.ts.

faq.question: What are the standard decimal values for common tokens?
faq.answer: Most tokens use 18 decimals. USDC and USDT use 6 decimals. WBTC uses 8 decimals. Verify before adding.

faq.question: Does this skill connect to blockchain nodes?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and templates only. You must manually verify addresses and test RPC connectivity.

faq.question: How do I add a chain that is not in the checklist?
faq.answer: Follow the pattern for existing chains. Add ChainId to schema.ts, update Rust enum, client constants, RPC config, and trade executor.

faq.question: What happens if I forget to update all files?
faq.answer: Runtime errors will occur when the application tries to look up the token or chain in files that were not updated.

faq.question: How is this different from manual registry updates?
faq.answer: This skill provides a systematic checklist to prevent missed files. It documents all required files and includes validation commands.
